title: DAY 12 Validation CRT AND INVALIDATION CRT
description: Understanding confirmation and invalidation of trading setups using structural analysis.
content:
In this lesson, you'll learn:

• What CRT (Confirmation Ready Trade) means
• CRT validation requirements
• Invalidation of trading bias
• Confirmation candle characteristics
• Bias formation based on structure
• Consequences of ignoring invalidation

quiz.question: CRT validation requires:
quiz.explanation: CRT validation needs alignment between your bias and liquidity levels.

quiz.question: Invalidation occurs when:
quiz.explanation: Bias is invalidated when the opposite structure breaks or a new structural level is reached.

quiz.question: Confirmation candle must:
quiz.explanation: Confirmation candles must close decisively beyond the level, not just touch with a wick.

quiz.question: Bias formation depends on:
quiz.explanation: Bias should be based on structural analysis combined with liquidity placement.

quiz.question: Ignoring invalidation leads to:
quiz.explanation: Ignoring invalidation means continuing to trade a dead bias, leading to losses.
